params.success: Boolean indicating whether the Gnosis Safe successfully executed the tx
params.txHash: The hash of the transaction that was executed

params.baseGas: Gas costs for that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Maximum gas price that should be used for this transaction.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the safe transaction.

getTransactionHash(address,uint256,bytes.details: Returns the hash of all the transaction dataIt is important to note that this implementation is different than that in the Gnosis Safe contractThis implementation does not use the nonce, as this is not part of the Guard contract checkTransaction interfaceThis implementation also omits the EIP-712 related values, since these hashes are not being signed by users

params.baseGas: Gas costs for that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Maximum gas price that should be used for this transaction.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the safe transaction.

params._transactionHash: The hash of the transaction data

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.baseGas: Gas costs for that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Maximum gas price that should be used for this transaction.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the safe transaction.
params.signatures: Packed signature data ({bytes32 r}{bytes32 s}{uint8 v})

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.interfaceId: The bytes representing the interfaceId being checked

returns._0: bool True if this contract supports the checked interface

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

checkAfterExecution(bytes32,bool).notice: Does checks after transaction is executed on the Gnosis Safe

checkTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,u.notice: This function is called by the Gnosis Safe to check if the transaction should be able to be executedReverts if this transaction cannot be executed

getTransactionQueuedBlock(bytes32).notice: Gets the block number that the transaction was queued at

queueTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,u.notice: Allows a user to queue the transaction, requires valid signatures

setUp(bytes).notice: Initialize function, will be triggered when a new proxy is deployed

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Can be used to check if this contract supports the specified interface

userdoc.notice: A guard contract that prevents transactions that have been vetoed from being executed on the Gnosis Safe
